column4: hi all, anyone up for helping out with a breezy upgrade problem? I am halfway through the upgrade and it errored out dpkg-deb: subprocess paste killed by signal (Broken pipe)
i am running a gnome session but it's dying trying to update kde libs
How did you do the upgrade? Through apt-get or using the upgrade gui?
If you use the update gui program, you can de-select the gdk and just keep gnome updates.
When you come to upgrade, you can go through them and de-select anything that you don't need.
Are you using breezy?
This may solve your problems. Breezy is very gnome friendly. I use it fine :)
it's if failing *during* the upgrade to breezy. hoary was a-ok.
hmm. I am guessing that you have already checked the possibility of a cd error?
not using CD. Upgrading from hoary via apt-get dist-upgrade
Ah. I have never done that so I can't think what it could be. Unless there is a conflict between the two. Have you tried running from the prompt rather than the gui?
yes i was running from gnome-term
scary huh?
hehe. Does sound like it :) I mean from the prompt - actually come right out of the gui back to the prompt
oh you mean quit X
Yes. If there is a conflict with the current gnome-gui, then this should solve that problem.
been running linux 6 months, not that brave yet ;)
will try if all else fails ;)
Have faith in yourself! I've only been using linux for two months. The thing to remember is that everything you do can be undone
look at man apt-get
Don't worry. It's still all new to me too.
